gnat.client
Class Run

java.lang.Object
  gnat.client.Run

public class Run
extends java.lang.Object

Represents a single run of Filters on a TextRepository.

Each Run needs a TextRepository and a list of Filters:
- the TextRepository can be set using setTextRepository(TextRepository) or created text-by-text using addText(Text).
- the filters can be added using addFilter(Filter).

A Context will be constructed that contains all the information about recognized genes (RecognizedGene), and their IdentificationStatus, that is, whether they have been assigned a single identifier or still have multiple candidates as potential solution.

One of the Filters has to load a GeneRepository, before final identification can happen. A typical filtering pipeline has steps for:
- named entity recognition (genes, species) with assignment of candidate IDs;
- loading of a gene repository that has information on each candidate;
- verification and direct identification of genes using external sources (Gene2PubMed, UniProt References, etc.);
- filtering of false positives: non-gene names, word sense disambiguation;
- filtering of false positives: exclusion of individual genes as not relevant to a text;
- disambiguation/ranking of remaining candidates;
usually in that order.

Author:
Jörg Hakenberg <jhakenberg@users.sourceforge.net>

Field Summary
 Context context
           
private  java.util.List<Filter> filterPipeline
          Contains the filtering steps that will be invoked on the texts, typically in the order:
- named entity recognition (genes, species) with assignment of candidate IDs;
- loading of gene repository that has information on each candidate;
- filtering of false positives (non-gene names);
- disambiguation of remaining candidates.
private  GeneRepository geneRepository
          Stores information on each gene candidate.
private  TextRepository textRepository
          Stores the collection of Texts that have to be processed.
 int verbosity
          Verbosity; 0: no output; 3: full status report after each filter (recognized genes, identified genes, ..)

          Constructs a new Run.

 void addFilter(Filter filter)
          Adds a Filter to the processing pipeline, which will be invoked on context, textRepository, and geneRepository.

          Adds a Text to the current textRepository.
 void clearTextRepository()
           
(package private)  void printCurrentStatus(java.io.PrintStream out)
          Log the current process of NER and disambiguation into the given stream.
For each level of identification (Recognized, Identified, Unidentified), prints a list of all genes and current candidate IDs, if any, per PubMed ID, together with the recognized gene name and its position.
 void runFilters()
          Runs all filters in the order given by filterPipeline, working on and changing context, textRepository, and geneRepository.
 void setFilenamesAsPubMedId()
          Assume that all file names in the textRepository are based on PubMed IDs: they have the form "some/path/id.txt", where path and extension could be missing, but the id needs to be numeric.
 void setTextRepository(TextRepository textRepository)
          Sets an entire TextRepository for this Run.

Method Detail

setTextRepository

public void setTextRepository(TextRepository textRepository)
Sets an entire TextRepository for this Run.

Parameters:
textRepository -

setFilenamesAsPubMedId

public void setFilenamesAsPubMedId()
Assume that all file names in the textRepository are based on PubMed IDs: they have the form "some/path/id.txt", where path and extension could be missing, but the id needs to be numeric. For each such text, sets the Text.PMID field to id.

Parameters:
textRepository -

Adds a Text to the current textRepository.

printCurrentStatus

void printCurrentStatus(java.io.PrintStream out)
Log the current process of NER and disambiguation into the given stream.
For each level of identification (Recognized, Identified, Unidentified), prints a list of all genes and current candidate IDs, if any, per PubMed ID, together with the recognized gene name and its position.

Parameters:
context -

runFilters

public void runFilters()
Runs all filters in the order given by filterPipeline, working on and changing context, textRepository, and geneRepository.

A status is printed to STDOUT after each filter if verbosity > 2, using {@link #printCurrentStatus(PrintStream)).
